newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia MNI reports first 6-mth results.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia MNI reports first 6-mth results.

text.p: Malaysian insurance group MNI Holdings Bhd, formerly known as Timah Langat Bhd, reported a net profit of 20.31 million ringgit in its first six-month results under the new name.
For the six months to September 30, 1996 the group reported an earnings per share of 7.5 cents per share.
Group turnover amounted to 248.24 million ringgit, and pre-tax profit was 31.05 million ringgit, the company said in a statement to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange (KLSE).
In September, Timah Langat reported a net profit of 284.76 million ringgit for the first six months to June 30 1996, and earnings per share of 106.6 cents per share.
Its group turnover was 275.25 million ringgit and it made a pre-tax profit of 154.34 million.
In a separate statement, MNI said its shares would be traded under its new name from December 30, 1996.
Malaysia National Insurance Sdn Bhd (MNI), the country's third largest insurance company, was in May injected into Timah, then a small manufacturing firm.

State investment fund, Permodalan Nasional Bhd holds an 80 percent stake in the enlarged capital of Timah. It earlier sold its 70 percent stake in MNI to Timah, which paid through an issue of new shares.
